reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel -- visit it during the day or evening but don't stay here. You can hear the trains going by and when they have a wedding here (which seems to be often) they take over the entire lobby so you can't even sit down there to enjoy it, and the noise is very disruptive to your stay as it continues late into the night.. the wedding definitely takes priority over the comfort of the other guests. The rooms are very small, too.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel has an incredibly beautiful old structure. Although the rooms are large, found the hotel to be very noisy. Had lobby noise radiating into my room til the lobby quieted down. Then trains (it is, after all, an old train station) rumbled by VERY LOUDLY just outside my window. I'm a pretty sound sleeper but these woke me up repeatedly throughout the night. Room was clean but had not been thoroughly vacuumed. Water ran out of shower across floor of bathroom. Front desk service was slow @ check in. Never could get the electronic key card lock to work on my friend's room (staff had to let her in each time). I might come here for a drink or dinner, but would never stay here again.
reviews.title: Cool building but too noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Planning a wedding around the unexpected flooding in Nashville proved to be daunting. When our original hotel closed and didn't have a firm date for reopening, we contacted the Wyndham and were pleasantly surprised that they not only had rooms available but would honor the rate we were quoted at a competing hotel. The staff was most gracious and attentive to our every need. The room was clean, comfortable and in keeping with the historic nature of this hotel. The highlight of the stay was the most comfortable mattress I've slept on in quite some time. I can unreservedly recommend this hotel to the most discriminating traveler. All requests were met with immediate attention and this hotel was spot on in every respect.
reviews.title: I'm buying a mattress like I slept on here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to splurge and booked a stationmaster suite for a wedding weekend in Nashville. It was a deluxe weekend at a reasonable price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed breakfast both mornings in Prime 108 and were awed every time we walked through the lobby. Worth the price!
reviews.title: Great character and fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I remember this place as a child on a train coming to visit her grandma -- I was thrilled walking through it then as I am 52 years later. The lobby is spectacular with its huge stainglass windows, high ceiling, sculpure and murals. My room was very comfortable with one of the best beds on which I've ever slept. The wide flat-screened TV was appreciated. I thoroughly enjoyed the hotel restaurant. The food was excellent -- the best Belgium waffles I've ever eaten. But it was the courteous service and attention from Manager Andy Phillips and his staff which endeared me most.
reviews.title: Grand hotel -- nostalgic and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely restoration BUT noisy with trains passing by frequently and last night they held a wedding out side our room on a balcony literaly 2 feet away........the band played very loudly for 4 hours so there was no rest. It seems like poor planning as we booked 5 months ago and so must have the wedding party. They could have placed us on the other side of the hotel rather than suggesting we pack up (1hr) and move at 9 PM). Very poor organizing.
reviews.title: Noisy place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: This is a great hotel, both in facilities and service. I took a senior adult tour group here for three nights and was exceptionally pleased with our stay. The rooms are beautiful. The entire hotel is beautiful. The location is great. And every staff person we dealt with was fantastic. They all went out of their way to be helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We also had a group dinner at the hotel that was spectacular.
reviews.title: Historic and comfy, great for a couple getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: We originally were scheduled to stay at Opryland Hotel but couldn't due to the flood and reconstruction. Union Station turned out to be a fantastic alternative that is just as nice as Opryland and more centrally located to the other sites we were visiting downtown.
reviews.title: Moldy and dirty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel for a mom's getaway and absolutely loved it! It's very quiet and the perfect location to all the Nashville nightlife. It's absolutely beautiful. The lobby is stunning. The rooms are a decent size and the beds are super comfortable. It would be a perfect hotel for a couples getaway, very romantic. The only downfall to me was no coffee shop. Not a big deal. It's just nice to have a place for a quick bite to eat and a cup of joe to go. it wouldn't stop me from staying there. I would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Don't Miss This

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For quietness, this was probably the worst room we have ever had in all the years of travel. Our room was on the ground level of the hotel approximately fifty feet from the railroad track. A fence separated us from the trains. The room literally shook every time a train went by, which in fact was all thru the night. Needless to say we got very little sleep that night. On the plus side the room was very clean, however very dark and un-appealing. The staff was courteous and the lobby is beautiful. I would suggest requesting a room on the opposite side of the tracks and on a high floor to get a restful night's sleep.
reviews.title: Beware of Rooms on Ground level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my fifth trip to Nashville and I was very much looking forward to staying at this Hotel, which I had admired from the outside on previous visits. We arrived on Friday evening at ~ 6 PM and I was immediately struck by how small the doors of the entrance were - it was somewhat difficult to easily navigate rolling baggage into the doors, especially with other folks leaving the hotel simultaneously. The lobby is grand and elegant and unique. It is one of those special places that one needs to see in person and written descriptions do not do it justice. Despite the fact that we arrived in the evening, our room was not yet ready and we had to wait about an hour. The room itself was small and ordinary with minimal amenities. The king size bed was comfortable but my sleep was often interrupted by the many trains that pass through Nashville during the night and early hours of the morning - I would strongly recommend not staying on the west side of the hotel. I arose early to exercise - the fitness room is on the seventh floor - and was quite disappointed in the facility. There were about 7-8 aerobic type machines and some free weights and very very limited space. Very little effort has been given to having a first rate exercise facility. My wife and I left to spend the day with our daughter (it was family weekend at Vanderbilt) and returned to the hotel at about 6 PM to find our room as we left it - housekeeping had not bothered to show up. We notified the front desk and they were left for dinner and when we returned later the room had finally been cleaned. We departed early Sunday morning.
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by its cover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say that I was quite disappointed in our stay at the Union Square. Although architecturally beautiful, the rooms, amenities, and service are not special and are at best ordinary. Internet was not free. The business center had 2 computers; one was broken and the other was incredibly slow. It took about 25 minutes to print out boarding passes; a process that should ordinarily take less than 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Beautiful but musty and hot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The services and amenities at other comparable nearby hotels (Hutton, Loews) are vastly superior. We will not be staying at this hotel during future visits to Nashville.
reviews.title: Great romantic getaway for a Mother's Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The a/c was out for almost 24 hours of our stay which made it very hot and sticky. Aside from the musty odor of the old building, it was very pretty. Everyone was very friendly but the cost of parking is ridiculous. We parked in valet (literally 15 feet from the front doors) for 4 hours for $22 before relocating to the self-park lot below for the rest of our stay. However, they billed the room for 3 days of valet which meant I had to stand in line at the front desk during checkout, then wait for her to call the valet manager to verify if my story was correct. I do have to say that the bar has the BEST chicken sandwich either of us have ever had.
reviews.title: Very smart hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used this hotel as a weekend getaway while seeing family. In the downtown section, it is distinctive among other buildings as an historic landmark. The lobby is beautifully restored and you feel as if you're walking into a train station. We were upgraded to a room on the second floor with high ceilings and it was wonderful. The staff is courteous and friendly. All in all a pleasure to stay there.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel - Very NIce for Something Different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife had a business conference here, so I was a tag along for a couple days of relaxation. We arrived later in the evening, but the hotel was easy to find. The valet arrived and took care of the car for us, which was nice because parking seemed to be hard to find. Here are my thoughts on the hotel:
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff: Very friendly. Concierge was very helpful in offering dining options. The bartender was great. All told, we were treated very well.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great if you have a young train fan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: SMALL. I don't know if all of the rooms are this small, but wow. Seriously, the king bed (wonderful!!!) took up most of the room. No desk or even another chair. No extra place to put your luggage other than stuffed inside a rather large armoire. Worse, our room was connected to some kind of conference room, so we had to eavesdrop over some company's stupid meeting whether we wanted to or not. Irritating. The bed, however, was GREAT! Lots of pillows, which is a bonus because some hotels get really stingy with the pillows. The bathroom was nicely decorated and of normal size, nothing huge but not puny either. Cool marble sink. Shower was nice...good pressure from the shower head and adequate hot water. Towels were some of the softest I have experienced at a hotel. I know it seems like such a small item, but I can't tell you how many higher end hotels offer sand paper towels. I was unable to locate a wi-fi signal, but i was told upon checkout that it's available...so I don't know. It wasn't advertised in the guest services book...but then I didn't ask either so who knows.
reviews.title: Great train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Misc: The hotel restaurant looked pretty good, but we dined elsewhere. We DID, however, enjoy the attached bar. We wanted cocktails but not the hassle of taxis or having one of us be the designated driver. The bar area was comfy, with couches and comfy chairs in addition to a nice bar. Great service as well.
reviews.title: Very nice!
